page.title: 11The Gregson Institute (C)
page.content: The Henry Gregson Memorial Hall was opened in 1890 as a parochial hall for Christ Church. In 1981 repair and maintainance costs forced the parish to sell the Hall.The original terms of the trust-that it should be used for ecclesiastical purposes had long since been broken.A group of local residents formed the Freehold Community Association and after 2 years of 'legal hassles' completed the purchase of the hall in July 1983 for 36000 pounds,with the help of grants from the City and County Councils.The renovated building was opened at the end of 1983. With help from the Urban Aid programme and local businesses the centre is manned by 5 MSC workers plus an army of volunteers.The centre houses a licensed club and meeting rooms and these are used by members and others for a variety of social activities.
